Name: Persepolis
Description: Persepolis - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire, founded by Darius I in 518 BCE.

Name: Tchogha Zanbil
Description: Tchogha Zanbil - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient Elamite complex with the best-preserved ziggurat in the world.

Name: Naqsh-e Jahan Square
Description: Naqsh-e Jahan Square - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Historic square in Isfahan surrounded by Safavid architecture.

Name: Persian Gardens
Description: The Persian Garden - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Nine gardens representing the diversity of Persian garden design.

Name: Gonbad-e Qabus
Description: Gonbad-e Qabus - UNESCO World Heritage Site. 53-meter high brick tower built in 1006 CE, the only remaining evidence of Jorjan.

Name: Citadel of Bam
Description: Bam and its Cultural Landscape - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient citadel and largest adobe building in the world.

Name: Pasargadae
Description: Pasargadae - UNESCO World Heritage Site. First capital of the Achaemenid Empire, founded by Cyrus the Great.

Name: Dome of Soltaniyeh
Description: Soltaniyeh - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Mausoleum of Oljaytu with the third largest dome in the world.

Name: Bisotun
Description: Bisotun - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient inscription and relief carved into a cliff face by Darius the Great.

Name: Armenian Monastic Ensembles of Iran
Description: Armenian Monastic Ensembles of Iran - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Three Armenian churches established between the 7th and 16th centuries.

Name: Shushtar Historical Hydraulic System
Description: Shushtar Historical Hydraulic System - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Complex irrigation system dating back to the 5th century BCE.

Name: Sheikh Safi al-din Khānegāh and Shrine Ensemble
Description: Sheikh Safi al-din Khānegāh and Shrine Ensemble - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Sufi spiritual retreat and shrine complex.

Name: Historic Bazaar of Tabriz
Description: Tabriz Historic Bazaar Complex - UNESCO World Heritage Site. One of the oldest and largest covered bazaars in the Middle East.

Name: Jameh Mosque of Isfahan
Description: Masjed-e Jāmé of Isfahan - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Grand congregational mosque representing over 1,200 years of Islamic architecture.

Name: Golestan Palace
Description: Golestan Palace - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Royal complex of the Qajar dynasty in Tehran.

Name: Susa
Description: Susa - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient city with a history dating back to the 5th millennium BCE.

Name: Cultural Landscape of Maymand
Description: Cultural Landscape of Maymand - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Village with troglodytic dwellings reflecting semi-nomadic agro-pastoralist culture.

Name: Lut Desert
Description: Lut Desert - UNESCO World Heritage Site. One of the hottest places on Earth with unique geological formations.

Name: Historic City of Yazd
Description: Historic City of Yazd - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Traditional earthen architecture and qanat system in the desert.

Name: Sassanid Archaeological Landscape
Description: Sassanid Archaeological Landscape of Fars Region - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Eight archaeological sites from the Sassanid Empire.

Name: Hyrcanian Forests
Description: Hyrcanian Forests - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient forest ecosystem dating back 25-50 million years.

Name: Cultural Landscape of Hawraman/Uramanat
Description: Cultural Landscape of Hawraman/Uramanat - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Remote mountainous region with stepped villages.

Name: Trans-Iranian Railway
Description: Trans-Iranian Railway - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Engineering marvel connecting the Caspian Sea to the Persian Gulf.

Name: The Persian Qanat
States: Razavi Khorasan, South Khorasan, Yazd, Kerman, Markazi, Isfahan
Description: The Persian Qanat - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Eleven qanats representing ancient water management systems.
